contentHtml: #121. What's the output? const config = { languages: [], set language(lang) { return this.languages.push(lang); }, }; console.log(config.language); javascript A: function language(lang) { this.languages.push(lang } B: 0 C: [] D: undefined Đáp án Answer: D The language method is a setter. Setters don't hold an actual value, their purpose is to modify properties. When calling a setter method, undefined gets returned. #122. What's the output
